internal.content:
---
title: Debug Manage Application
---
- Create a new server deployment or update the existing server deplyment
  - If creating a new for all server bundle type, replace the spec section with the existing all server. For example, `{instanceId}-{workspaceid}-servername`
    - Update the name. For eaxmple, {instanceid}-{workspaceid}-alldebug
  - Add port 7777 in the ports section.

Sample:
```
    ports:
      - containerPort: 9081
        protocol: TCP
      - containerPort: 9444
        protocol: TCP
      - containerPort: 7777
        protocol: TCP
```
  - Update cmd args.

Sample:
```
args:
    - >-
      echo generateKeyStore...; openssl pkcs12 -export -in
      /etc/ssl/certs/internal-manage-tls/tls.crt -inkey 
      /etc/ssl/certs/internal-manage-tls/tls.key -out ${java_keystore}
      -password pass:${java_keystore_password};
      /tmp/genJDBCTruststore.sh; /opt/ibm/wlp/bin/server debug
      defaultServer;
  ```
- Wait for pod to start
- On local machine, open PowerShell
- Install OpenShift Commandline (OC)[https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.2/cli_reference/openshift_cli/getting-started-cli.html]. 
- Log in to cluster using oc login and switch to correct project using `oc project` command
- Run: kubectl port-forward `<podname>` 7777:7777

```
kubectl port-forward sb1-masdev-alldebug-57d79d4dfc-q82vn 7777:7777

Forwarding from `127.0.0.1:7777 -> 7777`
Forwarding from `[::1]:7777 -> 7777`
Handling connection for 7777
```
- If needed kubectl can be obtained here: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/tools/
- In IDE (Eclipse), create a Debug Configuration (Remote Java Project) using localhost and port 7777. Launch it
  - Set the project with the Manange code. Use the (manageadmin image)['/upgrade/manageadmin'] to get the code
- The pod's logs will now show the server starting
- Create a service and route if you created a new deployment
- Use the new route location link to navigate to the Manange application if created a new deployment. Otherwise use the existing Manage route link. Append '/maximo' to the link.

MdxNode.rawBody:
---
title: Debug Manage Application
---
- Create a new server deployment or update the existing server deplyment
  - If creating a new for all server bundle type, replace the spec section with the existing all server. For example, `{instanceId}-{workspaceid}-servername`
    - Update the name. For eaxmple, {instanceid}-{workspaceid}-alldebug
  - Add port 7777 in the ports section.

Sample:
```
    ports:
      - containerPort: 9081
        protocol: TCP
      - containerPort: 9444
        protocol: TCP
      - containerPort: 7777
        protocol: TCP
```
  - Update cmd args.

Sample:
```
args:
    - >-
      echo generateKeyStore...; openssl pkcs12 -export -in
      /etc/ssl/certs/internal-manage-tls/tls.crt -inkey 
      /etc/ssl/certs/internal-manage-tls/tls.key -out ${java_keystore}
      -password pass:${java_keystore_password};
      /tmp/genJDBCTruststore.sh; /opt/ibm/wlp/bin/server debug
      defaultServer;
  ```
- Wait for pod to start
- On local machine, open PowerShell
- Install OpenShift Commandline (OC)[https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.2/cli_reference/openshift_cli/getting-started-cli.html]. 
- Log in to cluster using oc login and switch to correct project using `oc project` command
- Run: kubectl port-forward `<podname>` 7777:7777

```
kubectl port-forward sb1-masdev-alldebug-57d79d4dfc-q82vn 7777:7777

Forwarding from `127.0.0.1:7777 -> 7777`
Forwarding from `[::1]:7777 -> 7777`
Handling connection for 7777
```
- If needed kubectl can be obtained here: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/tools/
- In IDE (Eclipse), create a Debug Configuration (Remote Java Project) using localhost and port 7777. Launch it
  - Set the project with the Manange code. Use the (manageadmin image)['/upgrade/manageadmin'] to get the code
- The pod's logs will now show the server starting
- Create a service and route if you created a new deployment
- Use the new route location link to navigate to the Manange application if created a new deployment. Otherwise use the existing Manage route link. Append '/maximo' to the link.
